term.title: calcined coke

item.text: A petroleum coke or coal-derived pitch coke obtained by heat treatment of green coke to about 1600 K. It will normally have a hydrogen content of less than 0.1 wt.%.

notes.item: Calcined coke is the main raw material for the manufacture of polygranular carbon and polygranular graphite products (e.g. carbon and graphite electrodes).

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 479 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)
